data.title: What a place for lunch
data.text: On our way down highway 99 we stopped at this restaurant.  It was everything and more than expected. The staff was so pleasant and the food was outstanding.  Got the sweet potato fries and a burger.  Loved it. Good fast service which is always important when traveling.  Had to pick up some bakery goods also.  The woman who was at the counter pointed out what she had made that morning

data.title: Depends on the day unfortunately
data.text:
I would describe Toni's as a small café with both indoor (cramped) and outdoor (very cute...even has a little fountain) areas to eat.  There are a few things they are 'known' for and you are safe to get them, otherwise it's a bit of a gamble.

1.  Crustless quiche of the day & salad-Always tasty and different.  You get a large piece of quiche (almost like a frittata just not as dense) and a nice green salad.  It is enough to fill you up for sure and really the 'go to' item on the menu.

2.  Any salad on the menu is great!-Honestly, this is what I go here for (aside from the quiche).  They are fresh and made how you like it.  

Stay away from their baked goods.  They are NOT yummy or worth the calories...and I love dessert...they just disappoint.

My last comment is really about the staff.  They are not super friendly.  I'm sure others will disagree but they just aren't.  At times I actually feel like I'm bothering them.  Just the truth.  

Roll the dice and see what you get.  I'd say 75% you are going to be ok :-)

data.title: Great for lunch out on the patio
data.text: Have enjoyed the food, service and ambience on the outside patio. Patio is tucked back from road and noise, plenty of shade on a hot day.

data.title: Toni's Green Chili Soup
data.text: So, this gem of a restaurant is hidden in the heart of downtown Merced.  All fresh and organic produce will keep you coming back for more. My super favorite is Friday's they have the most awesome Green Chili Soup ! So many other things that are delish are the sandwiches particularly the Turkey Avocado Provolone  is out of this world !!!  Did I mention my 9 year old said they have the best pancake ever !

data.title: Fresh food with great service
data.text: We enjoy lunches here. Great menu with something for everyone. Absolutely fantastic soups, quiche, salads and sandwhiches. You can't go wrong with any of them. The green chili soup is one of my favorites. Tasty deserts as well.

data.title: Very Welcoming
data.text: We were close & wanted breakfast, so went for the #1 recommendation & were not disappointed. GENEROUS portions, super NICE waitstaff, modest pricing, & good food. Sausage patties especially delicious. Garden has a nice atmosphere too. Highly recommend.

data.title: Delish!!
data.text: Great lunch. Every item the four of our party had got raves- Chicken Mediterranean, chicken artichoke pannini, cheeseburger,soup & salad, sweet potato fries with a yummy sweet sour sauce, and a fresh fruit cake...to die for. Service was very friendly and efficient. Wanted to try neighbors entrees, as every item was beautifully presented. Ate in courtyard..pleasant, even in todays heat. Flys were the only negative. Wish this restaurant was in my town!!!

data.title: Glutenfrei frühstücken
data.text:
The best glutenfree pancakes i've ever had! THREE pieces and so big that i could nit eat!!!
And the waitress was the nicest i've ever had!!! So pitty that we are sooooo far away!!!!

data.title: Fresh. Fast. Friendly
data.text: Quality stays high over years of operation. Menu adjusts to reflect current trends or favorites.  Salads are always an excellent choice. The Sailor's Wrap is also excellent. May be the most consistent restaurant in Merced.  Eat in the patio or stay inside.  Both are great.

data.title: Girls lunch
data.text: Great lunch and enjoyed sitting in the courtyard.  I have never been disappointed. Also hosted a tea party for 15 little girl's and it was a huge hit.

data.title: great breakfast
data.text: we had company visiting from the city and decided that Toni's would be the place to eat after farmers market. Everyone had a different breakfast selection and from start to finish we had a great meal and visit.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: The chicken artichoke Panini was wonderful with the sweet potato fries. The other two people that joined me for lunch had the beef tip sandwich and they said the aus ju was really good also. And the best thing to drink is the sport tea. It's the only place in town you can get the sport tea. Very nice to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful weather

data.title: Excellent breakfast and quick service
data.text: We found Toni's from several good reviews. We had an excellent scramble breakfast and croissant breakfast sandwich. We walked in right as they were finishing serving breakfast but they quickly took our order and the food was served fresh and hot. It was the perfect stop before our drive home.

data.title: Perfect for lunch!
data.text: Had a delicious lunch, the atmosphere was just right to visit with a friend, and the service was great! Best fries around.

data.title: Decent food but over priced
data.text: Toni's may be a favorite to some but for me I'd rather not be shoved in like sardines having the next table practically on top of us. The food is ok but very overpriced. The service is hoity unless you are a regular.

data.title: Take out fast and delicious
data.text: Wonderful soup and sandwich place. Very friendly efficient staff. Quick take out service. Will plan to visit when I am back in the area.

data.title: Terrific lunch
data.text: Plenty of free parking made this an easy visit. We were a party of 4 for lunch and we had 4 different salads.  We all loved each of our choices: a Mediterranean chicken, a wild salmon, a chicken salad with tropical fruits, and a green salad with fruit and nuts.  The service was speedy and our waitress smiled the whole time.  Next time I will come for breakfast because the menu was very inviting. The pastry in the bakery also looked incredible but it was near closing and I'm sure it's better earlier in the morning.  For example, the eclairs were real custard instead of whipped cream. The cinnamon bread was begging me to take home a loaf.  This place was a definite winner and I will be back.

data.title: You MUST eat here! Best breakfast during our trip out west.
data.text: We ate here on our way to Yosemite. My husband had the California scrambler and I had the meat lovers omelet. We ate every single bite. After eating standard hotel breakfasts for 4 days, we were in heaven. Real ingredients and made fresh!  I wish we could have taken a loaf of the pumpkin bread with us. I highly recommend getting off the highway (its only a few miles) and trying this place out. You won't be disappointed. Sabrina was our waitress and she was great!

data.title: I LIKE Toni's!!
data.text: I haven't been here in awhile. So I was very thrilled when  a friend asked me to meet her here for lunch. The food is always very good and service is excellent. It's small and popular so if you want lunch here you need to go early. Enjoy the patio or inside. Either is nice.

data.title: Great food
data.text: I love Toni's! It's one of my favorite lunch spots. It's always busy and a little loud inside but the food is solid ..from the sandwiches (I think I've had them all and never had a bad one) to salads and quiche, they use fresh ingredients and are usually pretty efficient. The patio is nice too .
